00021 #include "FileInput.h"

00033 
00034 // Some machines (sparc) dont support unaligned memory access
00035 // The mmaped files are chock full of unaligned accesses.
00036 // When AFFY_NOUNALIGNED_MEM is defined we will do the 
00037 // alignment in software.
00038 // This feature can be enabled on intel for testing.
00039 
00040 // This is here to enable this feature automaticly on the sparc and ppc.
00041 // they cant do unaligned loads.
00042 #ifdef __sparc__
00043 #define AFFY_UNALIGNED_IN_SW
00044 #endif
00045 
00046 using namespace affymetrix_calvin_io;

00049 /*
00050  * Read an 8 bit number from the file.
00051  */
00052 int8_t FileInput::ReadInt8(std::ifstream &instr)
00053 {
00054         int8_t val = 0;
00055         instr.read((char *)&val, sizeof(val));
00056         return val;
00057 }
00058 
00059 /*
00060  * Read a 16 bit number from the file.
00061  */
00062 int16_t FileInput::ReadInt16(std::ifstream &instr)
00063 {
00064         int16_t val = 0;
00065         instr.read((char *)&val, sizeof(val));
00066         val = ntohs(val);
00067         return val;
00068 }
00069

00074 {
00075         int32_t val = 0;
00076         instr.read((char *)&val, sizeof(val));
00077         val = ntohl(val);
00078         return val;
00079 }

00114 /*
00115  * Read a 32 bit floating point value from a file.
00116  */
00117 float FileInput::ReadFloat(std::ifstream &instr)
00118 {
00119         type_punned pun;
00120         pun.v_uint32=ReadInt32(instr);
00121         return pun.v_float;
00122 }

00124 /*
00125  * Read a string from the file stream.
00126  */
00127 std::string FileInput::ReadString8(std::ifstream &instr)
00128 {
00129         int32_t len = FileInput::ReadInt32(instr);
00130         return FileInput::ReadString8(instr, len);
00131 }
00132 
00133 /*
00134  * Read a string from the file stream.
00135  */
00136 std::string FileInput::ReadString8(std::ifstream &instr, int32_t len)
00137 {
00138         char *buf = new char [len+1];
00139         instr.read(buf, len);
00140         buf[len]=0;
00141         std::string s=buf;
00142         delete[] buf;
00143         return s;
00144 }
00145 
00146 /*
00147  * Read the length (integer) then the string from the file.
00148  */
00149 std::wstring FileInput::ReadString16(std::ifstream &instr)
00150 {
00151         int32_t len = FileInput::ReadInt32(instr);
00152         return FileInput::ReadString16(instr, len);
00153 }
00154 
00155 /*
00156  * Read a string from the file.
00157  */
00158 std::wstring FileInput::ReadString16(std::ifstream &instr, int32_t len)
00159 {
00160         u_int16_t cvalue;
00161         wchar_t* s = new wchar_t[len+1];
00162         s[len] = 0;
00163         for (int i=0; i<len; i++)
00164         {
00165                 instr.read((char *)&cvalue, sizeof(int16_t));
00166                 cvalue = ntohs(cvalue);
00167                 s[i] = cvalue;
00168         }
00169         std::wstring result = s;        // assign wchar_t array to wstring because it will trunc string len to first 0 which may not be the same as len.
00170         delete [] s;
00171         return result;
00172 }
00173 
00174 /*
00175  * Reads a blob from a file.
00176  */
00177 int32_t FileInput::ReadBlob(std::ifstream &instr, const void*& value)
00178 {
00179         int32_t size = FileInput::ReadInt32(instr);
00180         char *buf = new char[size];
00181         instr.read(buf, size);
00182         value = buf;
00183         return size;
00184 }
00185 
00186 /*
00187  * Read an 8 bit number from a memory stream.
00188  */
00189 int8_t FileInput::ReadInt8(char * &instr)
00190 {
00191         int8_t val = *(int8_t *)instr;
00192         instr += sizeof(int8_t);
00193         return val;
00194 }
00195 
00196 /*
00197  * Read an 8 bit unsigned number from a memory stream.
00198  */
00199 u_int8_t FileInput::ReadUInt8(char * &instr)
00200 {
00201         u_int8_t val = *(u_int8_t *)instr;
00202         instr += sizeof(int8_t);
00203         return val;
00204 }

00206 /*
00207  * Read a 32 bit floating point value from a memory stream.
00208  */
00209 float FileInput::ReadFloat(char * &instr)
00210 {
00211         float fval;
00212         int32_t ival = ReadInt32(instr);
00213         memcpy(&fval, &ival, sizeof(ival));
00214         return fval;
00215 }

00263 /*
00264  * Read a string from the file stream.
00265  */
00266 std::wstring FileInput::ReadString16(char * &instr, int32_t len)
00267 {
00268         u_int16_t *cvalue = (u_int16_t *)instr;
00269         wchar_t* s = new wchar_t[len+1];
00270         s[len] = 0;
00271         for (int i=0; i<len; i++)
00272         {
00273                 s[i] = (wchar_t) ntohs(cvalue[i]);
00274         }
00275         instr += (sizeof(u_int16_t)*len);
00276         std::wstring result = s;        // assign wchar_t array to wstring because it will trunc string len to first 0 which may not be the same as len.
00277         delete [] s;
00278         return result;
00279 }
00280 
00281 #else // AFFY_UNALIGNED_IN_SW - We dont have unaligned access to memory
00282 
00283 /*
00284  * Read a 16 bit number from a memory stream.
00285  */
00286 int16_t FileInput::ReadInt16(char * &instr)
00287 {
00288         u_int8_t *ptr = (u_int8_t *)instr;
00289         int16_t val=0;
00290         val|=(*ptr++)<< 8;
00291         val|=(*ptr++);
00292         instr += sizeof(int16_t);
00293         return val;
00294 }
00295 
00296 /*
00297  * Read a 32 bit number from a memory stream.
00298  */
00299 int32_t FileInput::ReadInt32(char * &instr)
00300 {
00301         u_int8_t *ptr = (u_int8_t *)instr;
00302         int32_t val=0;
00303         val|=(*ptr++)<<24;
00304         val|=(*ptr++)<<16;
00305         val|=(*ptr++)<< 8;
00306         val|=(*ptr++);
00307         instr += sizeof(int32_t);
00308         return val;
00309 }
00310 
00311 /*
00312  * Read a 16 bit unsigned number from a memory stream.
00313  */
00314 u_int16_t FileInput::ReadUInt16(char * &instr)
00315 {
00316         u_int8_t *ptr = (u_int8_t *)instr;
00317         u_int16_t val=0;
00318         val|=(*ptr++)<< 8;
00319         val|=(*ptr++);
00320         instr += sizeof(u_int16_t);
00321         return val;
00322 }
00323 
00324 /*
00325  * Read a 32 bit unsigned number from a memory stream.
00326  */
00327 u_int32_t FileInput::ReadUInt32(char * &instr)
00328 {
00329         u_int8_t *ptr = (u_int8_t *)instr;
00330         u_int32_t val=0;
00331         val|=(*ptr++)<<24;
00332         val|=(*ptr++)<<16;
00333         val|=(*ptr++)<< 8;
00334         val|=(*ptr++);
00335         instr += sizeof(u_int32_t);
00336         return val;
00337 }

00339 /*
00340  * Read a string from the file stream.
00341  */
00342 std::wstring FileInput::ReadString16(char * &instr, int32_t len)
00343 {
00344         u_int8_t *ptr = (u_int8_t *)instr;
00345         wchar_t* s = new wchar_t[len+1];
00346         s[len] = 0;
00347         for (int i=0; i<len; i++)
00348         {
00349                 s[i] = 0;
00350                 s[i]|=(*ptr++)<< 8;
00351                 s[i]|=(*ptr++);
00352         }
00353         instr += (sizeof(u_int16_t)*len);
00354         std::wstring result = s;        // assign wchar_t array to wstring because it will trunc string len to first 0 which may not be the same as len.
00355         delete [] s;
00356         return result;
00357 }

00359 #endif

00361 /*
00362  * Read the length (integer) then the string.
00363  */
00364 std::string FileInput::ReadString8(char * &instr)
00365 {
00366         int32_t len = FileInput::ReadInt32(instr);
00367         return FileInput::ReadString8(instr, len);
00368 }
00369 
00370 /*
00371  * Read a string from the file stream.
00372  */
00373 std::string FileInput::ReadString8(char * &instr, int32_t len)
00374 {
00375         char *buf = new char [len+1];
00376         memcpy(buf, instr, len);
00377         buf[len]=0;
00378         std::string s=buf;
00379         delete[] buf;
00380         instr += len;
00381         return s;
00382 }
00383

00385  * Read the length (integer) then the string from the file stream.
00386  */
00387 std::wstring FileInput::ReadString16(char * &instr)
00388 {
00389         int32_t len = FileInput::ReadInt32(instr);
00390         return FileInput::ReadString16(instr, len);
00391 }
